segment.source: Applications Licenses Node
segment.target: Applications Licenses Node

segment.source: Applications Licenses Node
segment.target: Applications Licenses Node

segment.source: Applications Licenses Node
segment.target: Applications Licenses Node

segment.source: The Applications Licenses node is one level below the Application Virtualization System node in the Scope pane in the Application Virtualization Server Management Console.
segment.target: The Applications Licenses node is one level below the Application Virtualization System node in the Scope pane in the Application Virtualization Server Management Console.

segment.source: When you select this node, the Results pane displays a list of licenses and license groups.
segment.target: When you select this node, the Results pane displays a list of licenses and license groups.

segment.source: The following license types are available:
segment.target: The following license types are available:

segment.source: Unlimited License—Provides access for any number of simultaneous users.
segment.target: Unlimited License—Provides access for any number of simultaneous users.

segment.source: This method of licensing is appropriate when you want to associate an enterprise-wide license with an application.
segment.target: This method of licensing is appropriate when you want to associate an enterprise-wide license with an application.

segment.source: Concurrent License—Enables you to define the maximum number of concurrent users who are allowed to use the application.
segment.target: Concurrent License—Enables you to define the maximum number of concurrent users who are allowed to use the application.

segment.source: Named License—Enables you to assign a license to an individual user.
segment.target: Named License—Enables you to assign a license to an individual user.

segment.source: A named license can be used to ensure that a particular user will always be able to run the application.
segment.target: A named license can be used to ensure that a particular user will always be able to run the application.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can combine concurrent and named licenses for the same application.
segment.target: You can combine concurrent and named licenses for the same application.

segment.source: Right-click the Applications Licenses node to display a pop-up menu that contains the following elements.
segment.target: Right-click the Applications Licenses node to display a pop-up menu that contains the following elements.

segment.source: New Unlimited License
segment.target: New Unlimited License

segment.source: Displays the New Unlimited License Wizard.
segment.target: Displays the New Unlimited License Wizard.

segment.source: This wizard consists of the following pages:
segment.target: This wizard consists of the following pages:

segment.source: Enter the name of the license group in the Applications License Group Name field, and enter a value (in minutes) in the License Expiration Warning field.
segment.target: Enter the name of the license group in the Applications License Group Name field, and enter a value (in minutes) in the License Expiration Warning field.

segment.source: (You can enter any value from 0 through 100.) You can also use the up and down arrows to select the number of minutes.
segment.target: (You can enter any value from 0 through 100.) You can also use the up and down arrows to select the number of minutes.

segment.source: Enter brief descriptive text in the License Description field, and select the Enabled check box to enable the license.
segment.target: Enter brief descriptive text in the License Description field, and select the Enabled check box to enable the license.

segment.source: Optionally, you can use the Expiration Date field to specify an expiration date for the license.
segment.target: Optionally, you can use the Expiration Date field to specify an expiration date for the license.

segment.source: You can select the check box to use the displayed expiration date, or you can use the calendar utility to browse to the desired expiration date.
segment.target: You can select the check box to use the displayed expiration date, or you can use the calendar utility to browse to the desired expiration date.

segment.source: Click Finish to add the new license.
segment.target: Click Finish to add the new license.

segment.source: New Concurrent License
segment.target: New Concurrent License

segment.source: Displays the New Concurrent License Wizard.
segment.target: Displays the New Concurrent License Wizard.

segment.source: This wizard consists of the following three pages and is almost identical to the New Unlimited License Wizard:
segment.target: This wizard consists of the following three pages and is almost identical to the New Unlimited License Wizard:

segment.source: Enter the name of the license group in the Applications License Group Name field, and enter a value (in minutes) in the License Expiration Warning field.
segment.target: Enter the name of the license group in the Applications License Group Name field, and enter a value (in minutes) in the License Expiration Warning field.

segment.source: (You can enter any value from 0 through 100.) You can also use the up and down arrows to select the number of minutes.
segment.target: (You can enter any value from 0 through 100.) You can also use the up and down arrows to select the number of minutes.

segment.source: Enter brief descriptive text in the License Description field, and enter a value in the Concurrent License Quantity field.
segment.target: Enter brief descriptive text in the License Description field, and enter a value in the Concurrent License Quantity field.

segment.source: You can also use the up and down arrows to specify the number of concurrent licenses.
segment.target: You can also use the up and down arrows to specify the number of concurrent licenses.

segment.source: Select the Enabled check box to enable the license.
segment.target: Select the Enabled check box to enable the license.

segment.source: Optionally, you can use the Expiration Date field to specify an expiration date for the license.
segment.target: Optionally, you can use the Expiration Date field to specify an expiration date for the license.

segment.source: You can select the check box to use the displayed expiration date, or you can use the calendar utility to browse to the desired expiration date.
segment.target: You can select the check box to use the displayed expiration date, or you can use the calendar utility to browse to the desired expiration date.

segment.source: Click Finish to add the new licenses.
segment.target: Click Finish to add the new licenses.

segment.source: New Named License
segment.target: New Named License

segment.source: Displays the New Named License Wizard.
segment.target: Displays the New Named License Wizard.

segment.source: This wizard consists of the following four pages:
segment.target: This wizard consists of the following four pages:

segment.source: Enter the name of the license group in the Applications License Group Name field, and enter a value (in minutes) in the License Expiration Warning field.
segment.target: Enter the name of the license group in the Applications License Group Name field, and enter a value (in minutes) in the License Expiration Warning field.

segment.source: (You can enter any value from 0 through 100).
segment.target: (You can enter any value from 0 through 100).

segment.source: You can also use the up and down arrows to select the number of minutes.
segment.target: You can also use the up and down arrows to select the number of minutes.

segment.source: Enter brief descriptive text in the License Description field, and select the Enabled check box to enable the license.
segment.target: Enter brief descriptive text in the License Description field, and select the Enabled check box to enable the license.

segment.source: Optionally, you can use the Expiration Date field to specify an expiration date for the license.
segment.target: Optionally, you can use the Expiration Date field to specify an expiration date for the license.

segment.source: You can select the check box to use the displayed expiration date, or you can use the calendar utility to browse to the desired expiration date.
segment.target: You can select the check box to use the displayed expiration date, or you can use the calendar utility to browse to the desired expiration date.

segment.source: Click Add, Edit, or Remove named users.
segment.target: Click Add, Edit, or Remove named users.

segment.source: Click Finish to add the new license.
segment.target: Click Finish to add the new license.

segment.source: View
segment.target: View

segment.source: Changes the appearance and content of the Results pane.
segment.target: Changes the appearance and content of the Results pane.

segment.source: New Window from Here
segment.target: New Window from Here

segment.source: Opens a new management console with the selected node as the root node.
segment.target: Opens a new management console with the selected node as the root node.

segment.source: Refresh
segment.target: Refresh

segment.source: Refreshes the view of the server.
segment.target: Refreshes the view of the server.

segment.source: Export List
segment.target: Export List

segment.source: Creates a tab-delimited text file that contains the contents of the Results pane.
segment.target: Creates a tab-delimited text file that contains the contents of the Results pane.

segment.source: This item displays a standard File Save dialog box where you specify the location for the text file you are creating.
segment.target: This item displays a standard File Save dialog box where you specify the location for the text file you are creating.

segment.source: Help
segment.target: Help

segment.source: Displays the help system for the Application Virtualization Server Management Console.
segment.target: Displays the help system for the Application Virtualization Server Management Console.

segment.source: If you click a license group or license that appears under the Application Licenses node in the Scope pane, the following elements are available.
segment.target: If you click a license group or license that appears under the Application Licenses node in the Scope pane, the following elements are available.

segment.source: View
segment.target: View

segment.source: Changes the appearance and content of the Results pane.
segment.target: Changes the appearance and content of the Results pane.

segment.source: New Window from Here
segment.target: New Window from Here

segment.source: Opens a new management console with the selected node as the root node.
segment.target: Opens a new management console with the selected node as the root node.

segment.source: Delete
segment.target: Delete

segment.source: Deletes a package from the Results pane.
segment.target: Deletes a package from the Results pane.

segment.source: Rename
segment.target: Rename

segment.source: Changes the name of a package in the Results pane.
segment.target: Changes the name of a package in the Results pane.

segment.source: Export List
segment.target: Export List

segment.source: Creates a tab-delimited text file that contains the contents of the Results pane.
segment.target: Creates a tab-delimited text file that contains the contents of the Results pane.

segment.source: This item displays a standard File Save dialog box where you specify the location for the text file you are creating.
segment.target: This item displays a standard File Save dialog box where you specify the location for the text file you are creating.

segment.source: Properties
segment.target: Properties

segment.source: Displays the Properties dialog box for the selected license group.
segment.target: Displays the Properties dialog box for the selected license group.

segment.source: The General tab of the Properties dialog box displays information about the license group and lets you change the time value in the License Expiration Warning field.
segment.target: The General tab of the Properties dialog box displays information about the license group and lets you change the time value in the License Expiration Warning field.

segment.source: The Applications tab displays the list of applications associated with the license group.
segment.target: The Applications tab displays the list of applications associated with the license group.

segment.source: Help
segment.target: Help

segment.source: Displays the help system for the Application Virtualization Server Management Console.
segment.target: Displays the help system for the Application Virtualization Server Management Console.
